events.name: What You Need to Know about IPv6
events.description:
Don’t be left behind as we enter into the new phase of the Internet. Join us for a lunchtime talk with Mr Lawrence Hughes (CEO and Co-Founder of Sixscape Communications) as he expounds on the power of IPv6 and its application on areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G telephony, Cryptography and Personal Area Networks.
Lunch will be provided.

About our Speaker: Mr Lawrence Hughes

Mr Lawrence Hughes is a serial entrepreneur and inventor with years of experience in the IT realm under his belt. Since 1998, he has entered into four ventures in Messaging and Secure Messaging; his latest one being Sixscape Communications Pte Ltd, a startup with a mission to create a suite of apps leveraging on the new capabilities of IPv6. Mr Hughes created and presented internationally Crypto and Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) training for VeriSign and co-founded CipherTrust with its e-mail security gateway product, contributing to the company being sold for USD $273 million. He is also the co-chair of IPv6 Forum Singapore.
About Sixscape Communications

Winner of the Mondato Startup of the Year for Asia 2014, Sixscape Communications was founded with a focus on creating a suite of apps leveraging on the new capabilities of IPv6, including next generation PKI and secure messaging apps for Windows, Android & iOS, Certificate-based S/MIME security, & certificate-based crytographic authentification. It was awarded S$500,000 in SPRING Singapore grant and raised S$2 million from venture capitalist firm Tembusu ICT Fund I in November 2016.
Poster Elements designed by Freepik
events.location: National Library, 100 Victoria Street, Level 13, Singapore 188064

events.name: Create and launch Your Own Android App
events.description: This is a group for anyone interested in creating your own android app without any knowledge on programming language. I started this group to meet other people wanting to create their own android app, for business, for prototyping, for hobby, for fun etc. I created some android apps absolutely ZERO cost without knowing a single line of programming language like JAVA. Looking forward to exploring the Android app development without the knowledge of programming language with everybody in the upcoming workshop. Sign up via the link: nocodingiot.com (http://www.nocodingiot.com) for the upcoming workshop. https://www.facebook.com/buildyourownAndroidApp

events.name: WWCodeSg: Agile & Scrum
events.description: Agile is the bandwagon that all software companies wants to jump on to, we all know it as the buzzword that is easy to say but hard to master.  This time we have certified Scrum Masters for speakers for the night to help us demystify and explain Agile: Yue Lin CHOONG, Software Engineering Team Lead, PSMI from Scrum.orgRampreet Sandhu, Project Lead/Scrum Master, CSM from Scrum Alliance Agenda:6:30 PM: Food & Registration7:00 PM: Introductions7:15 PM: “Why Agile” by Yue Lin7:45 PM: Break8:00 PM: “Scrum Ceremonies” by Rampreet  8:30 PM: Wrap Up Psst, this event is intended for ladies only.
events.location: ThoughtWorks , 18 cross street #11-08 China Sq Central (S)048423, Singapore

events.name: AI Evening@SGInnovate: Manufacturing
events.description:
Industry 4.0 & the Future of Making ThingsSimon Ng, Head of Manufacturing Industry, Autodesk Southeast Asia
Factory Automation with Contacts in Unstructured EnvironmentsAssistant Professor Pham Quang Cuong, NTU
Challenges & Opportunities in Manufacturing with Artificial Intelligence, Robotics & Internet of Things C. K. Vishwakarma, Founder, CEO of AllThingsConnected.

Speakers Bio:
Simon NgSimon brings with him nearly 20 years of engineering software industry experience; 15 years of which have been spent at Autodesk Malaysia, Singapore and Japan, where he held various technical, industry marketing and sales management positions from 1999 to 2013. He left on a 2.5 years hiatus to lead Lexmark Malaysia and rejoined Autodesk family in his current role in early 2016. An Engineer by training, Simon started his career at Parametric Technology Corporation (PTC) after graduating with a degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Malaya and trained in Manufacturing Engineering under Association of Overseas Technical Scholarship in Yokohama Kenshu Center, Japan. He also holds a Masters in International Management from RMIT University in Australia. He is based in Malaysia and speaks English, Chinese, Malay and Japanese. 

Assistant Professor Pham Quang CuongCuong was born in Hanoi, Vietnam and grew up in Vietnam and then in France. He graduated from École Normale Supérieure rue d'Ulm, France, in 2007. He obtained a PhD in Neuroscience from Université Paris VI and Collège de France in 2009. In 2010, he was a Visiting Researcher at the University of São Paulo, Brazil. From 2011 to 2013, he was as a Fellow of the Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (JSPS), studying Robotics at the University of Tokyo. He joined NTU as an Assistant Professor in 2013. He was the recipient of the Best Paper Award at the conference Robotics: Science and Systems, 2012. His team won the second prize at the Airbus Shopfloor Challenge at ICRA 2016.

C. K. VishwakarmaCK is an experienced program manager and strategy leader in solutions design, integration and end-to-end program management of large complex projects. He conducts research and speaks on how technologies can prime enterprises for the future. He brings over 14 years’ experience in IIoT, M2M, Industrial Robotics and Broadcast Technologies. He founded both IoTSG and AllThingsConnected, where IoTSG is the largest and most active IoT community in South East Asia focused on enabling the development of collaborative IoT Ecosystem in the region, while AllThingsConnected is a professional services organization focused on helping organizations accelerate their journey in IoT development. 

Topics Description:
In this presentation, Simon will talk about the latest industry trends which are driving global manufacturing and infrastructure changes. Some of these changes are setting new directions of how products are being designed, made and used, to buildings and infrastructure being manufactured. Simon will share key technologies that are highlighted from Gartner's Hype Cycle. This Hype Cycle specifically focuses on the set of technologies that is showing promise in delivering a high degree of competitive advantage over the next five to ten years. We will explore and discuss various new technology predictions that will change our lives as well as discussing case studies of product as a service model, from ownership to access.

Robotics has largely contributed to increasing industrial productivity by automating many tedious or dangerous tasks, such as pick-and-place, welding, painting. The common points of these tasks are (i) they involve little contact interaction, (ii) they take place in highly structured environments, such as assembly lines. By contrast, tasks involving significant contact interactions and taking place in unstructured environments have so far resisted robotic automation. Addressing these challenges is therefore essential for the next generation of factory automation, which is bound to change the game in worldwide manufacturing. In this talk, Cuong will discuss how our group has been addressing these challenges by leveraging the most recent breakthroughs in AI and robotics.

In the age of exponential development in technologies, value creation remains the best metrics to define the impact of technologies in an industry. To achieve breakthrough growth in the future, while organisations need to make bold and disruptive moves, they have to take a phase wise approach understanding the risk and challenges. In this session CK will share his experienced approach with some real use cases, how an organization can be successful or may fail.

events.name: Pandas 101 & Networking
events.description: Course description: Pandas is a software library written for the Python programming language for data manipulation and analysis. It offers data structures and operations for manipulating numerical tables and time series. The name is derived from the term” Panel Data”, an econometrics term for multidimensional structured data sets. It is a high-level data manipulation tool developed by Wes McKinney. It is built on the Numpy package and its key data structure is called the DataFrame. DataFrames allow you to store and manipulate tabular data in rows of observations and columns of variables. Additionally, it has the broader goal of becoming the one of the most powerful and flexible open source data analysis / manipulation tool available in any language. Course Outline: In the real-world, data sets comes in many forms ranging from strings, integers, time-stamps and unstructured data. Due to better data collection and the rising adoption rate of IoT. The problem is how do you store data for future references, so that you can manipulate it and derive insight to solve problems for your business? The answer is in a Pandas DataFrame! In this workshop, you'll learn on how to use the industry-standard pandas library to import, build, and manipulate DataFrames. With Pandas, you'll always be able to convert your data into a form that permits you to analyze it easily. You'll also learn more about NumPy on how it stores data, and its relation to the pandas DataFrame. Things to Bring: 1) Your laptop - For the hands on session during the workshop 2) SGD $25 cash - For payment of workshop tickets to cover expenses Venue Sponsor: Afflatus Singapore Resource Partner: StartupHax Pte Ltd Speaker : Max received his Computing Science Degree from University of Glasgow through Singapore Institute of Technology. Previously he was part of the founding team for a coding academy as a curriculum development specialist. To teach Scratch & Python programming using the Raspberry Pi to children from the age 7 - 16 years old and adults. He's involved in technology or startup interest groups like Python User Group (PUGS), EDGE Society (A National Level for Youth Entrepreneurship), Singapore EdTech Meetup. Linkedin Profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/max-ong-zong-bao-b179b986/ PS: The ticket price is SGD $25 to be used to cover expenses for venue and other expenses. PSps: Do remember to bring your laptop along for the hands on session during the workshop.
